preqs: Students must have completed 48 credit points, including PGC5101 (PGC5001) and PGW5205 (PGW5127)

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 48 (I/W) credit points AND  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {PGC5001, PGC5101, PGW5127, PGW5205})
Must be enrolled in course version {2982, 2984, 2985, P6003}

unitName: Clinical risk management and wound care
description: This unit will provide students with a clinical risk management framework for managing and preventing wounds. This unit will explore the evidential basis for prevention strategies for wounds such as skin tears, leg ulcers, diabetes-related foot wounds and pressure injuries. Students will not only explore patient related issues associated with prevention but also examine the local environment and organisational factors that influence prevention in both the hospital and community setting.
faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
